title: Steady state (Aerobic)
description: This type of cardio refers to the pace of your workout and can involve any level of intensity. As the name sugges ts, the aim is to maintain a steady pace and intensity for the entire duration of your preferred workout.

title: Low & Moderate Intensity (Aerobic)
description: Low-intensity exercise can be measured as any exercise that keeps your heart rate below 50% of your MHR (maximum heart rate) — think a casual stroll or leisurely bike ride.

title: High Intensity And Intervals (Anaerobic)
description: Now we’re entering the high-intensity zone. This is where you can expect to work pretty darn hard, elevating and maintaining your heart rate above 70% of your MHR.
